content:
JOESTRADAMUS SEES RAIN ON THE RADAR TO THE SOUTH OF NYC BUT IT WILL ONLY GET SO FAR NORTH

Low pressure developing to the south is pushing rain northward but an upper air disturbance in upstate NY is trying to push it in the other direction. content:
JOESTRADAMUS ON THE UPCOMING HOT WEATHER

This is why JOESTRADAMUS DOES NOT LIKE the 3 day definition of a heatwave. The old definition was 5 days. 3 days of 90 degree temperatures is too easy and in this case, it will depend on location location location. It does appear that a back door cold front ends the streak on Wednesday with an onshore wind and temperatures about 10 degrees lower.

http://www.meteorologistjoecioffi.com/index.php/2017/06/08/heatwave-length-depends-backdoor-cold-front/
name: Meteorologist Joe Cioffi
title: Heatwave Length Depends On Backdoor Cold Front

content:
HEAT BEGINS SUNDAY WITH 90 PLUS HIGHS FOR 3 DAYS

I hesitate to call this a heatwave. 3 days of 90 plus to me is a dumb down version of a heatwave. It should go back to the 5 day definition. Sunday will be hot but not that humid...Monday and Tuesday will be hot and humid. There could be a few downpours running around late tonight and again late Saturday as we transition into the hot air mass. It all ends late Tuesday

content:
JOESTRADAMUS HAS BEEN LOOKING AT WEATHER MODELS THAT HAVE BEEN SHOWING SOME SORT OF TROPICAL SYSTEM DEVELOPING IN THE NW CARIBBEAN NEXT WEEKEND; BUT IT IS WISE TO REMAIN DUBIOUS AT THIS POINT

Weather models have been doing this for the last week or so and now that we are inside 7 days I thought it might be a good idea to take a look at what's going on. It would appear that the upper level winds and lower than normal pressures would grow favorable for development next weekend, however there are still way too many variables at play to take this seriously at this point.

http://www.meteorologistjoecioffi.com/index.php/2017/06/11/tropical-storm-possibilities-next-weekend-in-nw-caribbean-gulf-of-mexico/

content:
JOESTRADAMUS ON THE LONG RANGE

NO HEATWAVES AFTER THIS ONE FOR AWHILE

JET STREAM STRENGTHENS IN THE EAST..SOUTH OF NORMAL..COULD MEAN COOL AND WET OVERALL

TROPICS COULD SEE SOME ACTIVITY EARLY NEXT WEEK

The pattern is very interesting. It seems the ridges in the East are not lasting more than a couple of days before the trough in the east comes right back in. Such has been the case since early May. Eyes on the tropics for something in the NW Caribbean/SW Gulf of Mexico early next week but still very speculative.

JOE'S WEEKEND OUTLOOK IS UP

TROPICAL STORM CINDY REMNANTS SHOULD STAY TO OUR SOUTH

With a strong west to east flow across the United States it can't get hot and humid for more than a day or so, and it will keep any moisture from Tropical Storm Cindy to our south. At least that is the plan at the moment. If this is the case it should be a decent weekend.

content:
JOESTRADAMUS ON THE REMNANTS OF TROPICAL STORM CINDY

There will be two areas of rain with this. The first comes through tomorrow so there will be some downpours and thunderstorms running around but it will not rain all day and some may escape it.

The second comes Saturday morning with the core circulation which is basically a tight little ball of showers. This may produce rain for a couple of hours Saturday morning and then weather conditions improve rather quickly Saturday afternoon...sooner west and north of the coast. Sunday looks very good.

Latest video analysis on Tropical Storm Cindy Remnants and the long range weather pattern.

JOESTRADAMUS ON THE REMNANTS OF CINDY

We will probably see 3 rounds of downpours. The first Friday morning and it should be done by midday. The second Friday evening for a few hours. The last will be Saturday morning between 7am-11am. After that weather conditions improve rapidly Saturday afternoon and Sunday looks great. Some spots will see heavy rains of 1 to 2 inches while others will see far less.

SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS COULD GET NASTY IN SPOTS TODAY AS COLD UPPER AIR TROUGH MOVES THROUGH

I wouldn't be surprised to see some gusty winds and maybe some hail in one of these storms. We have very cold unstable air thanks to an upper trough and once the sun goes to work on that some thunderstorms will form. They should be scattered in nature with a mix of sun and clouds in between.

content:
JOESTRADAMUS HAS THE FORECAST FOR THE LONG HOLIDAY WEEKEND

Heat & humidity will be moving eastward Thursday and arrive Friday. From the standpoint of heat, this won't be too bad with highs in the upper 80s to lower 90s. Slightly lower humidity comes in Monday & Tuesday. Some thunderstorms come into the mix Friday and Saturday but they should be scattered. Sunday they could be more numerous. Monday & Tuesday should be free of any showers.

JOESTRADAMUS KNOWS THAT SOME ARE GOING TO BEGIN THEIR GETAWAY FOR THE 4TH OF JULY AS EARLY AS TODAY...GO FOR IT!

No real big changes in the weather outlook going forward through Tuesday. Much of the time it will be fine. Humidity a bit high beginning Friday into Sunday..a little lower Monday & Tuesday..very warm to hot at times but nothing excessive...and the chance for the odd shower or thunderstorm but nothing that gets in most peoples way.
